abstract: Higher than expected revenues will allow Metropolitan Transportation Authority to reduce $14.8 billion budget shortfall by at least $1 billion; agency plans to raise fares and tolls by 4 percent in 2017 and 2019.
lead_paragraph: With higher than expected revenues at the Metropolitan Transportation Authority, officials said they could reduce the budget shortfall to $13.7 billion or lower, from $14.8 billion.

headline.main: Shortfall Remains as M.T.A. Pays $1 Billion to Capital Plan
headline.print_headline: Shortfall Remains as M.T.A. Pays $1 Billion to Capital Plan

snippet: With higher than expected revenues at the Metropolitan Transportation Authority, officials said they could reduce the budget shortfall to $13.7 billion or lower, from $14.8 billion.
